node.title: SA's border is open. How are businesses responding?
node.alt: The shoulder of a volunteer is seen as they receive an injection by a person wearing gloves.
node.description: With the border open, South Australian businesses are having to adapt quickly. Some are imposing their own vaccine mandates, while others are calling for more clarity.Â
node.content:
["As South Australia opens its eastern borders to double-vaccinated travellers, many businesses are\u00a0frustrated that the buck will stop with them when it comes to vaccine mandates, while others\u00a0are just desperate for more clarity.\u00a0", "So far, the state government has mandated vaccination for people who work in healthcare settings, schools, preschools, early childhood facilities,\u00a0aged care facilities and for SA Police.\u00a0", "Yesterday, taxi and ride share drivers\u00a0operating at Adelaide, Mount Gambier, Parafield and Port Lincoln airports were added to the mandated list.\u00a0", "For other industries, the decision on whether to mandate their workers and customers be vaccinated remains up to the owner.", "David Armstrong from Goodwood Quality Meats said the government needed\u00a0to provide business owners with more clarity around mandates and what would happen\u00a0if there were\u00a0outbreaks.\u00a0", "\"When it comes to employees and if COVID comes into our business \u2014 I've done a lot of research into it, and I don't seem to be able to find a clear-cut answer to the issues we have in front of us,\" Mr Armstrong\u00a0said.\u00a0", "\"If COVID comes into the business via an employee, then we've got to potentially close down for two weeks for deep cleaning.", "\"However, if everyone is double-vaxxed, we trade as per normal.\"", "", "
Unley Physiotherapy owner Greg Rosenbauer has asked for all clients over the age of 12 years to show evidence they are double-vaccinated.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "Unley Physiotherapy owner\u00a0Greg Rosenbauer\u00a0made the decision to require all clients aged over 12 years of age to show evidence that they had been double-vaccinated.\u00a0", "\"We want, first and foremost, to protect the health of all of our clients and all of our staff,\" he said.\u00a0", "But Mr Rosenbauer said he also wanted\u00a0to find a way to continue to support\u00a0unvaccinated clients.\u00a0", "\"We will look to discuss, one-on-one with them, how we can best continue to help them, whether that be via telehealth or out-of-hours appointments \u2026 or it may be [that] a home-visit situation\u00a0might be the best way that we can support them,\" he said.\u00a0", "Mr Rosenbauer said he had spoken with other physiotherapy clinic owners around Adelaide and they all have a \"different\u00a0opinion\" on how to best meet the directive requirements.\u00a0", "\"It is a little bit difficult for us, particularly for a profession like ours when you are often in a small room with someone for an extended period of time,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"That's where it becomes very difficult for us to see unvaccinated clients in the clinic, because we really can't minimise the risk to us being\u00a0deemed close contacts.\"\u00a0", "St Andrew's Hospital in Adelaide has banned all unvaccinated visitors \u2014\u00a0even those who are aged under 12 years, who are ineligible for vaccination \u2014\u00a0unless there are exceptional circumstances.\u00a0", "", "
From Thursday, all taxi and rideshare drivers will need to have had at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Clements)
", "
Passenger transport industry reacts\u00a0
", "Point-to-point taxi drivers, rideshare operators and chauffeurs\u00a0must have had at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine by Thursday and have made a\u00a0booking for a second.", "Other passenger transport drivers must have had at least one dose by December 12.\u00a0", "\"We are aware of the fact that they will be collecting international arrivals from the airport and taking them to their place of quarantine and they will also be collecting vulnerable people who rely heavily on that service to attend doctor's appointments, supermarkets and other essential services,\" SA Police Commissioner Grant Stevens said yesterday.\u00a0", "The Transport Workers Union has\u00a0requested\u00a0an\u00a0urgent meeting with the state government over the mandate.", "Ian Smith, the union's national president and SA branch secretary,\u00a0said there had been a lack of consultation and the government should pay drivers if they needed time off to get vaccinated.\u00a0", "\"The mandate's been made by the government, in the end, and the government, in our eyes, should be paying for the process for people, number one to get vaccinated, two, if they feel any ill effects they should be paid for it,\" he said.\u00a0", "Outside Adelaide Airport yesterday, Uber driver Nas Yazdani said he supported the mandate for ride share drivers.\u00a0", "Fellow rideshare driver\u00a0Tilaye Teketel was also supportive of the mandate.\u00a0", "\"It's good. I'm fully vaccinated.\u00a0I've done everything.\u00a0I think everything will be fine,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
Premier Steven Marshall says employment would drop if vaccination was made mandatory for all workers in South Australia.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Clements)
", "
More vaccine mandates expected
", "The police commissioner has flagged that other industries could also be affected by vaccine mandates.", "\"I am aware that there are some specific groups that are being considered for mandatory vaccinations, based on the critical nature of the services they provide,\" Commissioner\u00a0Stevens said.\u00a0", "However for now, Commissioner\u00a0Stevens said, it remained\u00a0up to business operators to decide who they were\u00a0\"prepared to accept as patrons\".", "Some industries, including\u00a0the hospitality and\u00a0arts\u00a0sectors, want the state government to extend vaccine mandates to their workers.\u00a0", "However,\u00a0Premier Steven Marshall has ruled out a blanket approach.\u00a0", "\"The reality is that some people who want government to take the responsibility of making everything mandatory,\" Mr Marshall said.\u00a0", "\"There are plenty of other employees who want us not to do that.", "\"There are skill shortages in some sectors at the moment. If we made it mandatory for all workers in South Australia, we would lose employment, we would lose those skills and, in many sectors, this would undermine their capacity to trade.\"", "", "
